original: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because of attaining the result of the great seal in this very life.

original: rang byung ye shes zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan gyis ma byung ba'i rang rig gi ye shes so //
analyzed: rang byung ye shes zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan gyis ma byung ba'i rang rig gi ye shes so //
translated: The meaning of self-arisen gnosis is the gnosis of self-awareness that does not arise from other conditions.

original: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pas sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pas sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of wondrous is accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings through spontaneity.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning of I will explain is the remainder of the words.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis rtsom pa'i don brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis rtsom pa'i don brjod nas /
translated: Having thus expressed the meaning of the composition in two ways,

original: dngos su de bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su de bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to actually explain that,

original: de'i yan lag rten gyi ngo bo bshad pas gtso bo'i rtsa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rten gyi ngo bo bshad pas gtso bo'i rtsa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to explain the root of the principal channel by explaining its branch, the nature of the support,

original: rnal 'byor lus ni zhes bya ba ni sgom pa po'i lus so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor lus ni zhes bya ba ni sgom pa po'i lus so //
translated: the line the body of yoga refers to the body of the meditator.

original: bde ba chen po'i zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i gnas skabs sngon du 'gro bas bskyed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyis kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i gnas skabs sngon du 'gro bas bskyed pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyis kyang de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The “great bliss” is so called because it is generated by the prior state of great bliss, and because it is of the nature of that [great bliss].

original: 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: The “wheel” is the wheel of great bliss.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni grangs so //
translated: The “thirty-two” is the number.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni gdung ba zhi bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni gdung ba zhi bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “marvel” is so called because it pacifies the heat.

original: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rim rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rim rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “channels” are the lalana and so forth.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: The “perfect” is so called because of its unmistaken nature.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni le'u bcu bdun par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni le'u bcu bdun par bstan pa'o //
translated: The “explanation” is the teaching in the seventeenth chapter.

original: byang chub sems 'bab ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems 'bab ces bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: The “descent of bodhicitta” is the descent of the moon of relative bodhicitta.

original: gsal @132b zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal @132b zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Clearly” means “having made clear.”

original: de ltar rtsa'i gtso bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa'i gtso bo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the principal channels,🔽now, in order to explain the four joys, it is said “the four joys are the supreme joy and so on.”

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas khongs su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas khongs su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to describe their inclusion by way of their characteristics,

original: de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “those” and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i rtsa rnams so //
translated: The channels that abide in the great-bliss wheel.

original: bde ba chen po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de brjod pa'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: The “great-bliss place” is the wheel that is described by that name.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid nye bar mtshon pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “ Characteristics” is the nature that illustrates the essence.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: “ Should be explained” is what should be described.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni da lta nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni da lta nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Now” means “just now.”

original: aa ka tsa ta ta pa sde tshan dang zhes bya ba ni drug gi grangs so //
analyzed: aa ka tsa ta ta pa sde tshan dang zhes bya ba ni drug gi grangs so //
translated: “ The groups of a, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and pa” are the six.

original: ya ra la wa sha sha sa zhes bya ni ya'i sde tshan dang / sha'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas sde tshan gnyis te /
analyzed: ya ra la wa sha sha sa zhes bya ni ya'i sde tshan dang / sha'i sde tshan gyi dbye bas sde tshan gnyis te /
translated: “ Ya, ra, la, wa, śa, ṣa, and sa” are the two groups, ya and ṣa, by the division of the ya group and the ṣa group.

original: de ltar na brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar na brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are eight.

original: rigs pas shes par bya zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phung po ma lus pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pas shes par bya zhes bya ba ni chos kyi phung po ma lus pa bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: “To be understood through reasoning” means to be realized as the essence that includes all the aggregates of the Dharma.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni sde tshan brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni sde tshan brgyad po rnams so //
translated: “Again” refers to the eight groups.

original: bsdus nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni khongs su bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsdus nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni khongs su bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Having included” means having included them.

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi ngo bo'o //
translated: “In one place” means in the essence of the letter A.

original: yi ge tsam zhes bya ba ni chos nyid mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge tsam zhes bya ba ni chos nyid mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: “Merely a letter” means that which indicates reality.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi ngo bo'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi ngo bo'i yi ge'o //
translated: “That” refers to the letter in the essence of the letter A.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Peace” means the essence of the complete pacification of all.

original: yongs shes zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs shes zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: “Complete knowledge” means that which is not different from suchness.

original: byang chub sems la zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzhom du med pa'i ngo bo dang kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems la zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzhom du med pa'i ngo bo dang kun rdzob bo //
translated: “In the mind of enlightenment” means in the ultimate, which is the essence of the invincible, and in the relative.

original: thim nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni khongs su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thim nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni khongs su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having dissolved” means having gone into.

original: kun rtog thams cad spangs nas ni //
analyzed: kun rtog thams cad spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned all conceptual thoughts,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po don dam pa nyid do //
translated: This is the ultimate itself, the antidote to conceptualization.

original: bde ba kun gyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba kun gyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas so //
translated: The basis of all bliss is the mundane and supramundane states.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: Supreme means unsurpassed.

original: shes dang shes bya'i rnam par spangs //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i rnam par spangs //
translated: Free from the aspects of cognition and the cognized,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung dang 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means liberated from the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du yang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du yang ngo //
translated: Always means in the three times.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus ni thams cad du'o //
translated: The nature of all means the body is everywhere.

original: de ltar de rnams kyis mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas khongs su bsdu ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyis mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas khongs su bsdu ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the inclusion by way of characteristic,

original: spro ba'i rim pa de rnams nyid la rang gi ngo bo'i nges pa brjod pa'i phyir /🔽de las 'khor lo gsum dbye ba //
analyzed: spro ba'i rim pa de rnams nyid la rang gi ngo bo'i nges pa brjod pa'i phyir / de las 'khor lo gsum dbye ba //
translated: in order to state the ascertainment of the nature of those very emanations,🔽it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: From that, the three wheels are differentiated.

original: @133a * // aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i ngo bo rtsa brgyad kyi dbye bas 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @133a * // aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i ngo bo rtsa brgyad kyi dbye bas 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa is divided into eight roots, and by the division of the three wheels, there are twenty-four.

original: de rnams kyang lus ngag yid gsum gyi dbye bas lan gsum du bgrangs pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lus ngag yid gsum gyi dbye bas lan gsum du bgrangs pas so //
translated: Those are counted three times by the division of body, voice, and mind.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi po'i grangs de rnams lan gsum du bgrangs pas bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi po'i grangs de rnams lan gsum du bgrangs pas bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The “three” are the enumeration of the twenty-four. Those are counted three times, and the enumeration becomes seventy-two.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas nas so //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas nas so //
translated: “Clearly” means having made them clear.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: “That” refers to the seventy-two.

original: stong du rab tu phye ba'ang //
analyzed: stong du rab tu phye ba'ang //
translated: “Also divided into one thousand”

original: zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag bcu'i grangs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag bcu'i grangs so //
translated: is the enumeration of ten times one hundred.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re la bstan nas so //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re la bstan nas so //
translated: “Each” means having explained each nāḍī.

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni stong phrag stong phrag gi grangs kyis te /
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni stong phrag stong phrag gi grangs kyis te /
translated: “Having the nature of emanation” is the enumeration of thousands of thousands.

original: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyis rtsa rnams kyi grangs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyis rtsa rnams kyi grangs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The enumeration of the nāḍīs is seventy-two thousand.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum gyi dbye bas sngar gsungs pa'i 'khor lo gsum la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo spangs nas /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams ni rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum gyi dbye bas sngar gsungs pa'i 'khor lo gsum la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo spangs nas /
translated: The three wheels mentioned earlier, excluding the wheel of great bliss, are divided into the three humors of wind, bile, and phlegm, and so on, and the seventy-two thousand are the divisions of the wheels of enjoyment, phenomena, and emanation.

original: longs spyod dang / chos dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbye bas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / chos dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbye bas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: The seventy-two thousand are the divisions of the three wheels, excluding the wheel of great bliss, by the divisions of the three humors of wind, bile, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi ni //
translated: The great yoga tantras

original: zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra and so on.

original: de ltar spro ba'i rim pas de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spro ba'i rim pas de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of those deities through the process of emanation,

original: de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to teach the nature of those deities, he says the yoga of the seal and so on.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of being the nature of the karma seal.

original: mchog dang de nyid ces bya ba ni mchog gi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog dang de nyid ces bya ba ni mchog gi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Supreme reality means the nature of the supreme reality.

original: rtsa'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i sgo nas de la dmigs pa'o //
translated: and the focus on that by way of the channels.

original: lha'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni lha stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: lha'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni lha stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The so-called “stages of the deities” are the essence of the seventy-two thousand deities.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The “definition” of that is the definition.

original: rtsa so so'i zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re'i grangs ni lha re re'i ngo bo'o //🔽de nyid kyi phyir dbye ba yis /
analyzed: rtsa so so'i zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re'i grangs ni lha re re'i ngo bo'o // de nyid kyi phyir dbye ba yis /
translated: The “individual channels” are the number of each channel, which is the essence of each deity.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “by the divisions.”

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should know” means one should understand.

original: bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las te /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las te /
translated: “From the guru’s mouth” means from the mouth of a qualified vajra master.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “in the future.”

original: de ltar de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams kyi lha'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the essence of those deities in that way,

original: de rnams nyid kyi slar yang bsdus pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyi slar yang bsdus pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to again explain their summary,

original: de'i yan lag rtsa'i bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rtsa'i bsdus pa ni /
translated: it is said, “The summary of the channels that are its branches.”

original: de las kyang zhes bya @133b ba ni de'i rjes su'am /
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya @133b ba ni de'i rjes su'am /
translated: “From that” means after that.

original: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs so //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs so //
translated: The number of seventy-two thousand.

original: sdom sbyor bar zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdom sbyor bar zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: The compound “samāsa” means “collected”.

original: rigs pas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'o //
translated: “By reasoning” means by the immediately following teaching.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis la 'gro ba'o //
translated: the seventy-two thousand are the seventy-two movements.

original: de rnams kyi rtsa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis la zhes bya bar byas nas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtsa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis la zhes bya bar byas nas so //
translated: Those are the thirty-two nāḍīs.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun du bsten byas nas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir phan tshun du bsten byas nas zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said, “mutually supporting each other.”

original: phan tshun du 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: phan tshun du 'brel pa las so //
translated: From the mutual connection,

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that, it is said,

original: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis la zhes gsungs te /
translated: “the thirty-two nāḍīs.”

original: 'khor lo re re la 'khor lo bzhi'i grangs kyis so //
analyzed: 'khor lo re re la 'khor lo bzhi'i grangs kyis so //
translated: Each cakra has the number of the four cakras.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dang / thun brgyad kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad dang / thun brgyad kyi dbye bas so //
translated: “Supreme” is the eight consciousnesses and the eight periods.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i cha nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i cha nyid kyi phyir gsal ba'o //
translated: “Clear” is clear because it is the part of the cakra of great bliss.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: steng gi rtsa ba yal ga mgo //
analyzed: steng gi rtsa ba yal ga mgo //
translated: The upper root, the branches, the head,

original: lus ni shing zhes brjod par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni shing zhes brjod par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the body is said to be the tree.

original: rnal 'byor lus zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'i lus so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor lus zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa po'i lus so //
translated: The yogi's body is the practitioner's body.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog ste /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog ste /
translated: Supreme means the best,

original: gzhan rnams kyang sdud par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyang sdud par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the others are also included.

original: rtsa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rtsa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi'i dbye bas so //
translated: The thirty-two channels are divided into four cakras.

original: rmad 'byung zhes bya ba ni bsdu bar bya ba sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad 'byung zhes bya ba ni bsdu bar bya ba sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wondrous means the included is included in the includer.

original: gal te de ltar yin na rnal 'byor pas ji ltar nye bar mtshon zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na rnal 'byor pas ji ltar nye bar mtshon zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is the yogi to understand?

original: de'i phyir yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis phye bas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis phye bas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, by dividing the thirty-two letters.

original: dbyangs yig bcu drug thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: dbyangs yig bcu drug thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: The sixteen vowels are divided by method and wisdom.

original: thob ces bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob ces bya ba ni thob par bya ba'o //
translated: Attained means to be attained.

original: rnal 'byor mchog gis zhes bya ba ni sgom pa po'i khyu mchog rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mchog gis zhes bya ba ni sgom pa po'i khyu mchog rnams kyis so //
translated: By the supreme yogi means by the best of meditators.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always means at all times.

original: de ltar rten gyi ngo bo'i rtsa ba bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rten gyi ngo bo'i rtsa ba bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the root of the nature of the support,

original: brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: brten pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: in order to explain the mandala of the supported, the brief presentation of its limbs is stated:

original: phung po 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five are the aggregate of consciousness and so on.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The elements are the four such as earth.

original: don dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
analyzed: don dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga'o //
translated: The objects are the five objects such as form.

original: dbang po'i zhes bya ba ni drug ste lus kyi tshigs thams cad dang rgyus pa'i mtshams thams cad dang bcas pa'o //🔽sgo ni srung bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dpung pa dang / nye ba'i dpung pa dang / brla dang byin pa la @134a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i zhes bya ba ni drug ste lus kyi tshigs thams cad dang rgyus pa'i mtshams thams cad dang bcas pa'o // sgo ni srung bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni dpung pa dang / nye ba'i dpung pa dang / brla dang byin pa la @134a * //
translated: The sense faculties are the six, together with all the joints of the body and all the ligaments.

original: sogs pa'i dbye bas khro bo bcu rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dbye bas khro bo bcu rnams so //
translated: The doors are the protectors, which are the ten wrathful ones by the divisions of the shoulders, forearms, thighs, calves, and so on.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis dbye bdag nyid //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis dbye bdag nyid //
translated: The thirty-two are of the nature of the divisions.

original: ces bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: Thus, the thirty-two deities.

original: snang ba yi ni zhes bya ba ni brten pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba yi ni zhes bya ba ni brten pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The “illumination” is the dependent aspect.

original: de ltar phung po lnga la ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga la ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates are the five Buddhas.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi la spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi la spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo bzhi'o //
translated: The four elements, earth, etc., are the four goddesses, Locanā, etc.

original: yul rnams la ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: yul rnams la ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five objects are the five goddesses, Rūpavajrā, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga la sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad do //
translated: The five sense organs, eye, etc., are the eight Bodhisattvas, Kṣitigarbha, etc.

original: lus kyi yan lag dang nyid lag la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag dang nyid lag la sogs pa la /
translated: The limbs and minor parts of the body, etc.,

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: are the ten wrathful deities, Yamāntaka, etc.

original: sdud pas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sdud pas lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Thus, the mandala consisting of thirty-two deities is summarized.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Supreme” is because of the nature of intuition.

original: de ltar spro ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spro ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the dependent mandala by the process of emanation,

original: de rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain that extensively,🔽he says,

original: lus kyi gzhal yas khang du yang gsungs te /
analyzed: lus kyi gzhal yas khang du yang gsungs te /
translated: The body is also called the celestial mansion.

original: gzhal yas khang du mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa brten pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang du mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa brten pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the celestial mansion is the very essence of the yogi/nī who possesses the characteristics.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gru bzhi 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi //
analyzed: gru bzhi 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi //
translated: The four corners are the four noble truths.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi grva rnams nyid //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi grva rnams nyid //
translated: The four Brahmic abodes are the corners.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so forth.

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo lus so //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo lus so //
translated: That very thing is the body, which is the essence of the celestial mansion.

original: nang bzhugs pas zhes bya ba ni nang du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nang bzhugs pas zhes bya ba ni nang du spyod pa'o //
translated: The inner residents are those who dwell within.

original: de bzhin gshegs dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs dang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas are the five buddhas.

original: lha mo dang zhes bya ba ni spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo dang zhes bya ba ni spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goddesses are Buddhalocanā, and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi lha mo lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi lha mo lnga'o //
translated: The forms and so forth are the five goddesses of the objects.

original: rgyal sras zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad do //
analyzed: rgyal sras zhes bya ba ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad do //
translated: The sons of the victors are the eight bodhisattvas, Kṣitigarbha, and so forth.

original: khro bo bcu zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo bcu zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ten wrathful ones are Yamāntaka, and so forth.

original: yang dag bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la'o //
analyzed: yang dag bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus la'o //
translated: “In the right way” means in one’s own body.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i rim pas so //
translated: “That itself” means by the process of purification.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Supreme” means because of the nature of the supreme.

original: de ltar don rnam pa gnyis kyis spro ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par byas nas sdud pa'i rim pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa gnyis kyis spro ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad par byas nas sdud pa'i rim pas de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the maṇḍala of the process of emanation by means of these two topics, in order to teach that very [maṇḍala] by means of the process of gathering, [the Bhagavān] declares the essence of that [process] as a branch:

original: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni khro bo rgyal sras la zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni khro bo rgyal sras la zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: “The wrathful sons of the victors” are Yamāntaka and so forth, and the bodhisattvas Kṣitigarbha and so forth.

original: nang du mi @134b snang bar yang zhes bya ba ni nang du sdud pa'o //
analyzed: nang du mi @134b snang bar yang zhes bya ba ni nang du sdud pa'o //
translated: “Disappearing inside” is gathering inside.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Going” is going forth.

original: khro bo dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gzhan don la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro bo dang byang chub sems dpa' dag gzhan don la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the wrathful ones and the bodhisattvas with regard to the benefit of others.

original: rgyal sras rnams ni lha mo rnams //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams ni lha mo rnams //
translated: The sons of the victors are the goddesses.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa brgyad ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yul gyi lha mo rnams la bsdus pas 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa brgyad ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa yul gyi lha mo rnams la bsdus pas 'gro ba ste /
translated: Thus, the eight, such as Akashagarbha, are included in the goddesses such as Ruparati, the goddesses of the sense objects.

original: yul can rnams ni lus kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can rnams ni lus kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subjects are included within the body.

original: bsdus nas ni zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas so //🔽sa sogs zhes bya ba ni khams kyi lha mo spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi po rnams las so //
analyzed: bsdus nas ni zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas so // sa sogs zhes bya ba ni khams kyi lha mo spyan ma la sogs pa bzhi po rnams las so //
translated: Included means summarized.🔽From the four goddesses of the elements, such as Lochana,

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: those means the goddesses such as Ruparati.

original: 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: Go means included.

original: 'khor rnams ni gtso bo la bsdus pa'i phyir dang / lha mo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor rnams ni gtso bo la bsdus pa'i phyir dang / lha mo nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The retinue is included in the principal, and the goddesses are the same.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni khams kyi lha mo bzhi po'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni khams kyi lha mo bzhi po'o //
translated: Those means the four goddesses of the elements.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas lnga la ste /
translated: In the five Tathagatas means in the five Buddhas.

original: chos nyid chos rnams las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid chos rnams las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is not separate from phenomena.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la /
translated: In the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: da dag la yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: da dag la yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams so //
translated: “in them” refers to the five transcendent ones.

original: sku la sogs pa gsum bsdus nas //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa gsum bsdus nas //
translated: “Having gathered the three, body, and so forth,”

original: zhes bya ba ni khongs su bsdus par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khongs su bsdus par 'gro ba'o //
translated: means having included them.

original: gti mug gi rigs la rin chen 'byung ldan nang du sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi rigs la rin chen 'byung ldan nang du sdud pa'o //
translated: In the family of delusion, Ratnasaṃbhava is included.

original: gti mug dang nga rgyal dag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug dang nga rgyal dag gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because delusion and pride are the same.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs la las kyi rigs khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs la las kyi rigs khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the family of desire, the family of action is included.

original: chags pa'i dbang gis phrag dog skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i dbang gis phrag dog skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because jealousy arises through the power of attachment.

original: de kho na nyid mchog gcig pu de la yang ni zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mchog gcig pu de la yang ni zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: “In that supreme reality, which is one,” refers to the three, the vajra of body, and so forth.

original: gcig bu zhes bya ba ni grib ma'i rigs kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: gcig bu zhes bya ba ni grib ma'i rigs kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rigs la'o //
translated: “One” refers to the family of the shadow nature, the family of Mahāvajradhara.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: Supreme means beyond all conceptual elaboration.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Reality means the unfabricated nature.

original: thim nas zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas so //
analyzed: thim nas zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas so //
translated: Dissolving means gathering.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bde legs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bde legs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Peace means bringing about well-being.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: de'i phyir / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rnams las grol zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa rnams las grol zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be free from apprehended objects and apprehending subjects,

original: snang ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from appearances.

original: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gzhi //
translated: The basis of all bliss

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde @135a * //🔽pa'i rten la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde @135a * // pa'i rten la'o //
translated: means the basis of uncontaminated bliss.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: Supreme means unsurpassed, because there is nothing higher.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo'o //🔽nyams myong tsam las zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo'o // nyams myong tsam las zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyis so //
translated: That means the essence of Vajradhara.🔽From mere experience means from one's mind.

original: yi ge tsam zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa tsam rang gi sems so //
analyzed: yi ge tsam zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa tsam rang gi sems so //
translated: Mere letters means the mere aspect of experience, one's own mind.

original: yi ge tsam ni aa yig gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: yi ge tsam ni aa yig gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The mere letter is the nature of the letter A.

original: thim par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: thim par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the phrase “dissolves.

original: yi ge tsam ni thig ler thim //
analyzed: yi ge tsam ni thig ler thim //
translated: The mere letter dissolves into the drop.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi ge tsam ni aa yig gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi ge tsam ni aa yig gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The mere letter is the nature of the letter A.

original: thig le zhes bya ba ni phra ba dang rig pa'i ngang tshul can brjod du med pa la'o //
analyzed: thig le zhes bya ba ni phra ba dang rig pa'i ngang tshul can brjod du med pa la'o //
translated: The drop is the nature of the subtle, the nature of the inexpressible.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That also is the nature of the drop.

original: sgra la zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sgra la zhes bya ba ni brag ca'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: In sound means in the nature of the sound of an echo, in clear light.

original: thim nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: thim nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: Having dissolved means having been gathered.

original: sgra tsam zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang phra ba la'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang phra ba la'o //
translated: The mere sound is even more subtle.

original: 'od gsal ba la'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba la'o zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la'o //
translated: In clear light means in the reality of emptiness free from all elaborations.

original: 'od gsal go 'phang zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal go 'phang zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The state of clear light is the nature of clear light.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Correctly” means having the nature of being non-erroneous.

original: spro ba dang bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis de dang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang gi bskyed pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyis de dang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The characteristic of expansion and contraction” means that it is understood to have the nature of expansion and contraction, because it is free from the characteristic of being produced and destroyed by itself.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i rim pas de'i bshad pa rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i rim pas de'i bshad pa rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of that [consciousness] by the sequence of contraction,

original: de nyid kyi ming gi rnam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ming gi rnam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the name of that [consciousness],

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says “consciousness.”

original: de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That [consciousness] is the nature of natural luminosity.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi rnam pas thams cad shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes brjod do ;
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi rnam pas thams cad shes pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes brjod do ;
translated: It is called “consciousness” because it knows everything by the mode of nature.

original: / chos kyi dbyings dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi dbyings te /
translated: The “dharmadhātu” is the realm of phenomena.

original: rigs shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: rigs shes par byas nas so //
translated: Having made that known,

original: don dam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mchog gi ye shes kyi yul nyid kyi phyir dang / mchog gi skyes bu'i don nyid kyi phyir dang / rang nyid kyi dgos pa chen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mchog gi ye shes kyi yul nyid kyi phyir dang / mchog gi skyes bu'i don nyid kyi phyir dang / rang nyid kyi dgos pa chen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate, etc. is the object of the highest intuition, the object of the highest person, and the great purpose of oneself.

original: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa bzlog pas don dam pa byang chub sems kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ma lus pa bzlog pas don dam pa byang chub sems kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The great bliss is the form of ultimate bodhicitta, because it turns away from all suffering.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The freedom from subject and object is because there is no appearance of object and sense-faculty.

original: byang chub sems ni zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rnam pa'i byang chub kyi yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni zhes bya ba ni sku gsum gyi rnam pa'i byang chub kyi yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The bodhicitta is the object of enlightenment in the form of the three bodies.

original: dri ma med ces @135b bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med ces @135b bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stainless is because of the afflictions, the knowable, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The Vajrasattva is the form of the realization of the reality of emptiness.

original: zhi ba che zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nyid nas nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba che zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nyid nas nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Great peace” is because of the peacefulness from the very beginning.

original: gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyi zung du 'jug pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyi zung du 'jug pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Nondual intuition” is because of the expression of the union that is its own nature.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol med par sems can gyi don la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol med par sems can gyi don la 'jug pas so //
translated: “Wondrous” is because of the engagement in the welfare of sentient beings without effort.

original: dbang bskur ba bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni dbang bzhi pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni dbang bzhi pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Fourth consecration” is the nature of the fourth consecration.

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni dpe'i sgo nas mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni dpe'i sgo nas mtshon pa'o //
translated: “Bliss” is the illustration by way of an example.

original: bzhi pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba ni don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Fourth joy” is the nature of the four joys in the aspect of the meaning of the innate.

original: go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽de sogs ming gi bye brag gis //
analyzed: go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de sogs ming gi bye brag gis //
translated: “Supreme stage” is because of the aspect of the path of no learning.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbye bas so //
translated: “By the various names such as these” is by the various names.

original: gsungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: “It is said” is the expression.

original: go 'phang mchog ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: go 'phang mchog ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The supreme state is the nature of the Bhagavat.

original: spro ba dang sdud pa'i dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: spro ba dang sdud pa'i dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i rnam pas so //
translated: By the division of emanation and withdrawal is by the aspect of both.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: Just as it is is by the nature of non-error.

original: rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims kyis so //
analyzed: rim pa zhes bya ba ni go rims kyis so //
translated: The sequence is by the order.

original: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i rim pas brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad do //
translated: Thus, by the two aspects, the sequence of the mandala of the support is explained.

original: de ltar brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad nas ;
analyzed: de ltar brten pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad nas ;
translated: Having explained the mandala of the support in that way,

original: nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the summary,

original: de ltar bskyed nas rdzogs pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed nas rdzogs pa ni //
translated: having generated in that way, the perfection

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: is taught.

original: le'u 'di nyid las bstan pa'o //
analyzed: le'u 'di nyid las bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught in this very chapter.

original: bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the guru's mouth is the meaning of to be known by the master.

original: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni ngag gi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi rig par bya ba'o //
translated: Self-awareness is to be known by oneself because it is not an object of speech.

original: ye shes kyi mchog ces bya ba ni bsgoms bzhin pa nyid kyis ye shes mchog gi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mchog ces bya ba ni bsgoms bzhin pa nyid kyis ye shes mchog gi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “supreme intuition” is the cause of the supreme intuition, because it is the cause of the supreme intuition that is being cultivated.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Peace” is because external proliferation is pacified.

original: gnyis med mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i snang ba nye bar chad pas gcig pa la chos kyi dbyings tsam po'i lhag ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis med mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i snang ba nye bar chad pas gcig pa la chos kyi dbyings tsam po'i lhag ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Having the characteristic of nonduality” is because it is the remainder of the mere plane of phenomena, since the appearance of difference is cut off.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The glorious Vajra Garland, a great yoga tantra

original: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: is composed by the paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa.

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u bco brgyad pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u bco brgyad pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the eighteenth chapter of the treatise Illuminating the Meaning of the Tantra, called “The Illuminating Lamp,” which elucidates the profound meaning.

original: // @136a * //  de ltar le'u bco brgyad pas rnal 'byor pa'i lus la rtsa bsdus pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir brjod nas /
analyzed: // @136a * //  de ltar le'u bco brgyad pas rnal 'byor pa'i lus la rtsa bsdus pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir brjod nas /
translated: Having thus expressed the reply to the question about the channels and elements in the yogi’s body in the eighteenth chapter,

original: da ni sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to respond to the question about the object of the moment of the various, etc.,

original: le'u bcu dgu pa nye bar ston cing de rtsom pa ni /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: le'u bcu dgu pa nye bar ston cing de rtsom pa ni / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the nineteenth chapter is presented, and it is begun:

original: le'u bco brgyad pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the explanation of the eighteenth chapter,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngar la ltos nas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽sna tshogs la sogs skad cig 'gag / mtshan nyid ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngar la ltos nas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro // sna tshogs la sogs skad cig 'gag / mtshan nyid ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: furthermore, in relation to the previous, because of the difference.🔽The various, etc., are momentary cessations,🔽connected with the statement “character.”

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig thun mong ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig thun mong ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Character means the engagement in the reality of the uncommon moment of the various, etc.

original: brda bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i brda'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: brda bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i brda'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Like a sign means the nature of the appropriate sign for oneself.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: Correct means by the nature of non-error.

original: ji lta ba bzhin nyon zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa nyed kyis mnyan par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin nyon zhes bya ba ni rtse gcig pa nyed kyis mnyan par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Listen properly means listen with one-pointedness.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself means by the aspects of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de ltar sna tshogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan 'debs par rtsom pa dngos su de bshad par rtsom pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar sna tshogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan 'debs par rtsom pa dngos su de bshad par rtsom pa ni /
translated: Thus, having begun to answer the question about the object of the moment of variety, he begins to explain it in actuality.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, of various aspects, etc.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Of various aspects is because of the aspects of embracing and kissing.

original: rnam par smin zhes bya ba ni de'i phyin ci ma log gi ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba'i ye shes la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin zhes bya ba ni de'i phyin ci ma log gi ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba'i ye shes la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ripened means because of enjoying the intuition of bliss that is its unerring nature.

original: rnam par 'joms dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Conquering is because of the nature of seeing bliss.

original: mtshan nyid bral zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang chags bral spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bral zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang chags bral spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Free from characteristics is because of abandoning attachment and non-attachment.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhis so //
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhis so //
translated: Four is because of four aspects.

original: skad cig ma zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i nyams su myong ba'i dngos po rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes gsungs zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i nyams su myong ba'i dngos po rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: The term moment refers to the things experienced in a moment, and the term name refers to the name of those things.

original: rnam par phye nas slar bshad pa //
analyzed: rnam par phye nas slar bshad pa //
translated: Having distinguished them, they are explained again.

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: The term distinguished refers to the things that are expressed by the distinctions.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ro //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ro //
translated: Now, the term now refers to the present time.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'dod //
translated: The term various refers to the various things that are desired.

original: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The term desired refers to the great bliss that is desired.

original: 'di man chad le'u bcu dgu pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung mdor te /
analyzed: 'di man chad le'u bcu dgu pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung mdor te /
translated: From here on, the text up to the end of the nineteenth chapter is the summary.

original: de'i phyir 'di gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is placed here.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Vajra Garland, the great yoga tantra,

original: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: composed by the paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa,

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya @136b ba las le'u bcu dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya @136b ba las le'u bcu dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: is called The Clarifier of the Profound Meaning. Here ends the extensive explanation of the nineteenth chapter.

original: // / de ltar le'u bcu dgu pas sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u bcu dgu pas sna tshogs la sogs pa skad cig gi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the object of the moment, such as the various, in the nineteenth chapter,

original: da ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to state the reply to the question about the object of the division of joy, etc.,

original: le'u nyi shu pa ston par byed cing /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu pa ston par byed cing /
translated: the twentieth chapter is taught.

original: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: First, in order to demonstrate its composition,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then, etc. is stated.

original: le'u bcu dgu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //🔽dga' ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: le'u bcu dgu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o // dga' ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: After the explanation of the nineteenth chapter,🔽it is connected with the explanation of the characteristics of the four joys.

original: dga' ba bzhi po ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi po ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi'o //
translated: The four joys are those with the characteristics to be explained.

original: mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: The characteristic is the engagement of one's own nature.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir lugs 'byung zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lugs 'byung zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, in forward order.

original: 'khor lo bzhi'i ltos pas lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las zlog pa dag gis so //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi'i ltos pas lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs las zlog pa dag gis so //
translated: By the order of the four wheels, in forward and reverse order.

original: ji lta ba'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: ji lta ba'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: “As it is” means by way of the unmistaken nature.

original: rim pa ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: “In due order” means in accordance with the sequence.

original: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the composition,

original: dngos su de bshad pa'i yan lag 'og tu rgyu ba la brten nas /🔽dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su de bshad pa'i yan lag 'og tu rgyu ba la brten nas / dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain that, the following is the branch of explanation,

original: dga' ba bde ba dang po ste //
analyzed: dga' ba bde ba dang po ste //
translated: in dependence on the cause, in order to teach the divisions of joy and so forth,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said:🔽Joy is the first bliss.

original: cung zad bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: cung zad bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis dga' ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of joy is the nature of bliss, due to the nature of just a little bliss.🔽Supreme joy is the second,

original: mchog tu dga' ba gnyis pa dang // zhes bya ba ni snga ma las lhag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba gnyis pa dang // zhes bya ba ni snga ma las lhag pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of being superior to the former.🔽The third is called “the separation from joy,”

original: dga' bral zhes bya gsum pa dang // zhes bya ba ni chags bral gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bral zhes bya gsum pa dang // zhes bya ba ni chags bral gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of being free from attachment.

original: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par bshad //
analyzed: bzhi pa lhan cig skyes par bshad //
translated: The fourth is explained as being innate,

original: ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam pa gsum spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dga' ba rnam pa gsum spangs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because of the nature of abandoning the three types of joy.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of the unfabricated.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dgyes pa rdo rje'i rgyud las /
analyzed: dgyes pa rdo rje'i rgyud las /
translated: In the Hevajra Tantra:

original: cung zad bde ba dga' ba ste //
analyzed: cung zad bde ba dga' ba ste //
translated: Slight bliss is joy,🔽supreme joy is beyond that,

original: mchog tu dga' ba de las lhag / dga' bral chags pa bral 'gyur te //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba de las lhag / dga' bral chags pa bral 'gyur te //
translated: separation from joy is free from attachment,

original: bzhi ba 'di rnams dang ni bral //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi ba 'di rnams dang ni bral // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the fourth is free from these.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the brief presentation,

original: lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pas dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the divisions of joy and so forth in the reverse order,🔽it is said:

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo dga' ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The emanation wheel is joy,🔽the dharma wheel is supreme joy,

original: dga' ba'i sgras brjod par bya ste /🔽byang chub kyi sems kyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi dbus su aa'i yi ge yod pa'i phyir dang / gyen du rgyu bas byang chub kyi sems khyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sgras brjod par bya ste / byang chub kyi sems kyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi dbus su aa'i yi ge yod pa'i phyir dang / gyen du rgyu bas byang chub kyi sems khyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the enjoyment wheel is separation from joy,

original: mchog @137a * //
analyzed: mchog @137a * //
translated: the great wheel is free from the fourth.🔽The emanation wheel is joy,

original: dga' chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: dga' chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
translated: the dharma wheel is supreme joy,🔽the enjoyment wheel is separation from joy,🔽the great wheel is free from the fourth.🔽The emanation wheel is joy,

original: zhes bya ba ni der de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i sa bon mchog gi ngo bo rnams yod pa'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du rgyu bas byang chub kyi sems khyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni der de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i sa bon mchog gi ngo bo rnams yod pa'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du rgyu bas byang chub kyi sems khyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the supreme essence of the seed of the Tathagata and the goddess exists, and the bodhicitta is carried by the movement as before.

original: longs spyod dga' ba bral ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ro drug la longs spyod pas de'i yul la dga' ba dang dga' bral sngar bzhin byang chub kyi sems thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽lhan cig skyes dang bde ba che //
analyzed: longs spyod dga' ba bral ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ro drug la longs spyod pas de'i yul la dga' ba dang dga' bral sngar bzhin byang chub kyi sems thob pa'i phyir ro // lhan cig skyes dang bde ba che //
translated: The enjoyment of the six flavors is the enjoyment of the six flavors. The separation from the joy of that object is the separation from the joy of that object. The attainment of the bodhicitta is as before.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The innate and the great bliss are the essence of the innate of the great bliss cakra.

original: de la ha yig gi dbyibs mi shigs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig tu 'dres pas khyad par can gyi bde ba nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ha yig gi dbyibs mi shigs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyis byang chub kyi sems dang lhan cig tu 'dres pas khyad par can gyi bde ba nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, the shape of the syllable ha is the indestructible. Because of the experience of the special bliss by the mixing of the bodhicitta with itself.

original: lugs bzlog rim pa zhes su gsungs //
analyzed: lugs bzlog rim pa zhes su gsungs //
translated: The reverse sequence is said to be the reverse sequence.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pa 'dis lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rim pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i rim pa 'dis lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rim pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gsungs te /
translated: Thus, by the previously stated process, the nature of the reverse order is stated, which is not the sequence.

original: de ltar lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the analysis of the ecstasies, etc., in terms of the reverse order,

original: lugs las byung ba'i rim pas de'i rnam par dbye ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de rjes lugs 'byung bshad bya ste //
analyzed: lugs las byung ba'i rim pas de'i rnam par dbye ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir / de rjes lugs 'byung bshad bya ste //
translated: in order to teach the analysis of the limbs in terms of the forward order,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: after that, the forward order is to be explained.

original: go rims kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: go rims kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of the sequence.

original: bde chen 'khor lo'i spyi bo la //
analyzed: bde chen 'khor lo'i spyi bo la //
translated: In the head of the great-bliss wheel,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa rlung gi 'khor lo'i mthar thug pa la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa rlung gi 'khor lo'i mthar thug pa la'o //
translated: on the thirty-two-petaled wind wheel at the end.

original: de ni dga' bar bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de ni dga' bar bshad pa yin //
translated: That is explained as joy.

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi mes gdungs pa'i stobs kyis zhu bar byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi khams de las 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi mes gdungs pa'i stobs kyis zhu bar byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi khams de las 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhicitta element melts by the power of being heated by the fire of wisdom, it moves from there.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la'o //
translated: After that,

original: longs spyod ces bya ba ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug la me'i 'khor lo'i mthar thug par mchog dga'o //
analyzed: longs spyod ces bya ba ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug la me'i 'khor lo'i mthar thug par mchog dga'o //
translated: The “enjoyment” is the supreme joy at the end of the fire wheel on the sixteen-petaled enjoyment wheel.

original: mgrin pa las lhag pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par cung zad yan lag thams cad la byang chub kyi sems kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgrin pa las lhag pa'i gnas kyi mthar thug par cung zad yan lag thams cad la byang chub kyi sems kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “joyless” is the end of the place above the throat, because the bodhicitta pervades all the limbs.

original: dga' bral chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: dga' bral chos kyi 'khor lor gnas //
translated: The “joyless” is located in the dharma wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa brgyad kyi ngo bo chos kyi 'khor lo ste byang chub kyi sems kyis de 'thob pas chags pa dang chags bral dag la de nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa brgyad kyi ngo bo chos kyi 'khor lo ste byang chub kyi sems kyis de 'thob pas chags pa dang chags bral dag la de nyid du rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dharma wheel is the nature of the eight channels, and because the bodhicitta reaches that, it is known as the “joyless” in both passion and the absence of passion.

original: 'dir yang tha mal pa'i dang rnal 'byor pa'i dga' bral gyi gnas skabs bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang tha mal pa'i dang rnal 'byor pa'i dga' bral gyi gnas skabs bla ma'i zhal las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the ordinary and the yogic states of joylessness should be understood from the guru’s instruction.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lor @137b lhan cig skyes /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lor @137b lhan cig skyes /
translated: The “innate” is in the emanation wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i bar du thob pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i bar du thob pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i gnas skabs rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the state of innate joy by the attainment from the emanation wheel up to the secret.

original: de nyid la bla ma'i man ngag gi stobs kyis don gyi lhan cig skyes pa bsgoms pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la bla ma'i man ngag gi stobs kyis don gyi lhan cig skyes pa bsgoms pas shes par bya'o //
translated: And just that should be understood by the power of the guru's instruction through the cultivation of the innate meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: nyams su myong bar byed ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed ces bya ba ste /
translated: One should experience.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gdams ngag bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i gdams ngag bsgoms pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should cultivate the special instruction.

original: de ltar lugs las 'byung ba'i rim pas de rnam par 'byed pa rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lugs las 'byung ba'i rim pas de rnam par 'byed pa rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of the analysis in the forward order,

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lta dang 'gugs dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba de rnam par dbye ba'i phyir lta dang 'gugs dang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: in order to analyze the divisions of the states, he says, The view, the summoning, and the binding.

original: rnal 'byor pha dang rnal 'byor ma'i lta ba ni mthong ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pha dang rnal 'byor ma'i lta ba ni mthong ba ste /
translated: The view of the yogin and yoginī is seeing.

original: bya ba'i rnam pa dgug pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa khyad par can gyi dam tshig rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni lta dang 'gugs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam pa dgug pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa khyad par can gyi dam tshig rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni lta dang 'gugs pa'o //
translated: The pledge of the special aspect of the rite of summoning is the realization of the rite of summoning and gazing.

original: de bzhin brda zhes bya ba ni lus ngag gi ngo bo'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brda'o //🔽kha la 'o ni byed pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin brda zhes bya ba ni lus ngag gi ngo bo'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brda'o // kha la 'o ni byed pa yi //
translated: The so-called sign is the sign of the yoginis of the nature of body and speech.🔽The kissing is🔽with the lips.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchus mchu 'jibs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchus mchu 'jibs par byed pa'o //
translated: The kissing is with the lips, the sucking of the lips.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kha la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kha la zhes gsungs te /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be on the mouth,

original: gdong gi'o // dga' ba'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i ngo bo dga' ba'i gnas skabs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gdong gi'o // dga' ba'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i ngo bo dga' ba'i gnas skabs shes par bya'o //
translated: on the face. The state of joy is to be known as the state of joy of that nature.

original: ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: ji lta bus she na /
translated: By what means?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan nyid do ;🔽/ zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan nyid do ; / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The various characteristics.

original: 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: 'khyud pa dang 'o byed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji skad du /
translated: The various characteristics are the various characteristics of the rite of summoning and the rite of kissing and so on, as before.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las /
translated: As it is said in the Later Guhyasamaja Tantra:

original: sna tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs grangs //
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs grangs //
translated: The various, of various types, and numerous,

original: 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa // zhes gsungs so //
translated: embracing, kissing, and so on.🔽The supreme yoga of yoginīs

original: rnal 'byor rnal 'byor ma mchog tu //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnal 'byor ma mchog tu //
translated: is the supreme yoga of yogins and yoginīs.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma ni thabs dang shes rab dag gis yang dag par 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma ni thabs dang shes rab dag gis yang dag par 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The supreme yoga of yogins and yoginīs is the arising, the birth, by means of method and wisdom.🔽Grasping the hair

original: skra la 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni skra 'phyang ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: skra la 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni skra 'phyang ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: is the form of hanging hair.

original: de ni gcig go //
analyzed: de ni gcig go //
translated: That is one.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor ba'i rnam pa ni /
translated: Similarly, the form of the union of vajra and lotus🔽is the second stage.

original: gnas skabs gnyis pa'o ;🔽/ skad cig mchog ces bya ba ni mchog dga'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo ni skad cig ces brjod do //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis pa'o ; / skad cig mchog ces bya ba ni mchog dga'i gnas skabs kyi ngo bo ni skad cig ces brjod do //
translated: The supreme moment🔽is called the moment of supreme joy.🔽The moment of maturation

original: rnam smin skad cig ces bya ba ni gnas skabs de nyid de rnam smin skad cig go //
analyzed: rnam smin skad cig ces bya ba ni gnas skabs de nyid de rnam smin skad cig go //
translated: is that very stage, the moment of maturation.

original: rnam smin de'i phyin ci log go //
analyzed: rnam smin de'i phyin ci log go //
translated: Maturation is the opposite of that.🔽That itself is consciousness.🔽That itself is the cause.

original: de nyid rgyur ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: de nyid rgyur ni rnam par shes //
translated: That itself is the result.
