analyzed: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs so // ma yig gi gnas brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares its greatness.

original: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to state the greatness of the letter ma by way of stating its location,

original: yi ge ma ni gyen du rgyu ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yi ge ma ni gyen du rgyu ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, the letter ma is the upward-moving,

original: srog rlung yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog rlung yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: which is to say, it is the life-force wind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir rlung gi 'khor lo la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung gi 'khor lo la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, [the Bhagavān] declares, on the wind wheel,

original: rlung gi 'khor lor ro //
analyzed: rlung gi 'khor lor ro //
translated: on the wind wheel.

original: dpral bar zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpral bar zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The forehead is the middle of the eyebrows.

original: de ltar ma yig gi gnas brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: de ltar ma yig gi gnas brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Thus, having first stated the location of the letter A,

original: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs so //
translated: he states its greatness.

original: yi ge gsum po bsdus pa'i rnam pas de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas /
analyzed: yi ge gsum po bsdus pa'i rnam pas de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas /
translated: Having first purified it by the form of the collection of the three letters,

original: de dag gcig gyur ces bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: de dag gcig gyur ces bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: he says, “They become one.”

original: de ma thag par bshad pa'i yi ge gsum bsdus par byas nas so //
analyzed: de ma thag par bshad pa'i yi ge gsum bsdus par byas nas so //
translated: Having collected the three letters just explained,

original: snying ga la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i gnas la'o //
analyzed: snying ga la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i gnas la'o //
translated: at the heart, which is the location of the Dharma wheel,

original: thugs kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: thugs kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i sa bon no //
translated: the seed of mind, which is the seed of Akshobhya,

original: nges par phyung zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du ngag gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges par phyung zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du ngag gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is definitely drawn out, which means in the form of the sound.

original: mi bskyod @149a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod @149a * //
translated: Akshobhya

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'i h'um yig go //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'i h'um yig go //
translated: is the essence, which is the letter Hum just explained.

original: kha dog nag ces bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi kha dog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog nag ces bya ba ni rang gi rigs kyi kha dog nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Black in color, because of the color of its own family.

original: gzugs med khams kyi ming can no //
analyzed: gzugs med khams kyi ming can no //
translated: is the name of the formless realm.

original: zhes bya ba ni de gcig tu phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid can sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de gcig tu phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid can sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of mind, consisting of the four aggregates alone.

original: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis so sor rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis so sor rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the extensive explanation of each of the four topics,

original: de nyid la don rnam pa gsum gyis sems kyi sa bon bstan nas /
analyzed: de nyid la don rnam pa gsum gyis sems kyi sa bon bstan nas /
translated: he teaches the seed of mind with three topics in that very [place].

original: de'i nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to state its summary,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yi //
translated: [he says,] the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: [This refers to] Vairocana and so forth.

original: rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: Fully explained means expressed.

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Essence refers to the nature of the three syllables.

original: de ltar don bzhis yi ge gsum bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don bzhis yi ge gsum bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the explanation of the three syllables with four topics,

original: de'i nang nas gtso bo'i yi ge bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nang nas gtso bo'i yi ge bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the principal syllable from within that,

original: de'i yan lag de'i don nyid zhu bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag de'i don nyid zhu bar byed pa ni /
translated: he asks about the meaning of that very branch:

original: slar yang zhus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang zhus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, ask! and so on.

original: sngar gyi zhus pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: sngar gyi zhus pa la ltos nas so //
translated: In relation to the previous request.

original: thams cad mkhyen la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: To the Omniscient One means to the Omniscient One who knows all phenomena just as they are.

original: phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni zhu ba po'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni zhu ba po'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi is the petitioner.

original: thal sbyar nas zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: thal sbyar nas zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: With palms joined means with the palms of both hands joined.

original: gus par byed pa sngon du 'gro bas yongs su zhu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus par byed pa sngon du 'gro bas yongs su zhu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he makes a request preceded by respect.

original: ci zhig zhu bar byas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig zhu bar byas she na /
translated: What does he request?

original: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says the division of the abodes,

original: rdo rje gsum gyi zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: of the three vajras means of the vajras of body, etc.

original: yi ge'i don zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum gyi mchod par brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i don zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum gyi mchod par brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the syllables means the praise of the three syllables that should be expressed.

original: gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rten gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rten gyi dbye bas so //
translated: The division of the abodes means by the division of the supports characterized by the wheel of Dharma, etc.

original: rtogs lags na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi drin gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs lags na zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi drin gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: If realized means if realized through the grace of the Lord.

original: ji lta bu zhig gtso bor gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig gtso bor gsungs she na /
translated: What is the principal one that is taught?

original: de'i phyir 'di rnams zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rnams zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says these,

original: yi ge gsum po 'di rnams kyi nang nas so //
analyzed: yi ge gsum po 'di rnams kyi nang nas so //
translated: from among these three syllables.

original: ji lta bu zhig bdag po zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig bdag po zhe na /
translated: What is the lord?

original: de'i phyir yi ge gang gis gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge gang gis gtso bo nyid do //
translated: Therefore, he says the syllable that is the principal one.

original: ji lta bu zhig gtso bor gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig gtso bor gsungs she na /
translated: What is the principal one that is taught?

original: de'i phyir gtso bo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtso bo zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says the principal one.

original: gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das la bod pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das la bod pa ste /
translated: The principal one is addressed to the Lord,

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the lord of the five buddhas.

original: de ltar de'i don nyid du zhu ba bstan nas bcom ldan @149b 'das kyi gsung la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas de bshad par dam bca' ba bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis slar yang gsungs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar de'i don nyid du zhu ba bstan nas bcom ldan @149b 'das kyi gsung la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas de bshad par dam bca' ba bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis slar yang gsungs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, having taught the request in that sense, in order to explain that, having first engaged in the speech of the Lord, he teaches the promise to explain, saying the Lord again spoke.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni sngar la ltos nas so //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni sngar la ltos nas so //
translated: Again means in relation to before.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The Blessed One has been explained previously.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba che zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rdo rje chen po 'chang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba che zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rdo rje chen po 'chang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Great Vajra Holder is so called because he holds the great vajra, which is the essence of natural luminosity.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i bdag po nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i bdag po nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chief is so called because he has attained lordship over the three realms.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni sbas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni sbas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The secret is so called because it is hidden.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog nyid do //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog nyid do //
translated: The supreme is so called because it is the highest.

original: gsang ba yin zhes bya ba ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba yin zhes bya ba ni zab pa'o //
translated: The secret is so called because it is profound.

original: sbas pa'i don ni zhes bya ba ni myur ba nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbas pa'i don ni zhes bya ba ni myur ba nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The hidden meaning is so called because it is not quickly understood.

original: khyod dri ba zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje 'dri ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis phan yon gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod dri ba zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje 'dri ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis phan yon gsungs pa'o //
translated: You ask is spoken by the Blessed One in response to Vajrapāṇi's question, stating the benefits.

original: rgyud rnams kun du sbas pa ni //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun du sbas pa ni //
translated: The hidden in all tantras

original: zhes bya ba ni bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bya ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams la'o //
translated: refers to the natures of action and so forth.

original: mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
translated: Listen is the application to listening.

original: yang dag bshad kyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gsal bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag bshad kyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gsal bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase by the true explanation means by the unerring nature, the meaning of which is to be made clear.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung la 'jug pas sngon du 'gro bas de bshad par rtsom pa bstan nas /🔽gtso bo'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung la 'jug pas sngon du 'gro bas de bshad par rtsom pa bstan nas / gtso bo'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the composition of the treatise by way of the preliminary engagement with the speech of the Bhagavān,🔽[the author] now begins the explanation of the nature of the main body of the treatise.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To that end, he states the principal [topic],🔽beginning with the words the principal.

original: gtso bor ni gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: gtso bor ni gtso bo nyid do //
translated: Principal means the most important.

original: thugs kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni h'um gi yi ge mi bskyod pa'i sa bon nyid la'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi sa bon zhes bya ba ni h'um gi yi ge mi bskyod pa'i sa bon nyid la'o //
translated: The seed of mind refers to the syllable hūṃ, which is the seed of Akṣobhya.

original: de nyid la thams cad kyi nang nas gtso ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid la thams cad kyi nang nas gtso ba nyid do //
translated: That [syllable] itself is the most important of all,

original: chos thams cad sems la rag las pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad sems la rag las pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena depend on the mind.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog med ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is stated to be nonconceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pas ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ma gos pa'o //
translated: It is not sullied by conceptuality.

original: kun gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyis kun la nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyis kun la nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “All” means in every way, in all situations of affliction and purification.

original: gang gi phyir gtso bo gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ni gang las so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtso bo gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ni gang las so //
translated: “Because the other main ones” means because of what.

original: gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni ngag dang lus kyi sa bon rnams las so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni zhes bya ba ni ngag dang lus kyi sa bon rnams las so //
translated: “The others” means the seeds of speech and body.

original: 'grib dang de bzhin 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: 'grib dang de bzhin 'phrog par byed //
translated: “Diminish and steal away”

original: ces bya ba ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang rlung gnyis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang rlung gnyis so //
translated: means conceptualization and the two kinds of wind, respectively.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi sa bon las brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi sa bon las brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs so //
translated: Because the collection of conceptualizations, which is the seed of mind, has a number of one hundred and eight,

original: 'grib dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yongs su shes nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grib dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yongs su shes nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “diminish” means that they will be abandoned through the complete knowledge of their nature.

original: rlung gnyis ni srog dang thur sel gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rlung gnyis ni srog dang thur sel gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The two kinds of wind are the life-force and the evacuative wind.

original: @150a * // 'phrog par byed ces bya ba ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas 'phro bar byed pa ni rnam par zlog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: @150a * // 'phrog par byed ces bya ba ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas 'phro bar byed pa ni rnam par zlog par byed pa ste /
translated: “Seizes” means that through cultivating mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, one stops the dispersion of the mind.

original: de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one understands its nature.

original: rnam pa gnyis po de dag ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / lus kun la ni khyab par byed //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po de dag ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / lus kun la ni khyab par byed //
translated: How is it twofold?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “It pervades the entire body.”

original: srog 'dzin pa thams cad la thams cad du khyab pa'o //🔽sna yi bu ga dag la rgyu //
analyzed: srog 'dzin pa thams cad la thams cad du khyab pa'o // sna yi bu ga dag la rgyu //
translated: It is the life-force that pervades the entire body.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sna'i bu ga gnyis kyi lam nas rgyu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi sna'i bu ga gnyis kyi lam nas rgyu bar byed pa'o //
translated: “It moves through the nostrils” means that it moves through the path of the two nostrils of the relative body.

original: lus la zhes bya ba ni lus nyid la'o //
analyzed: lus la zhes bya ba ni lus nyid la'o //
translated: “In the body” means in the body itself.

original: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba ni de dang de'i las bsags pas so //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed ces bya ba ni de dang de'i las bsags pas so //
translated: “It arises” means that it arises through the accumulation of its karma.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus rtag tu'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus rtag tu'o //
translated: “Always” means constantly.

original: gang gi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi che ba'i bdag nyid kyi mthus so //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi che ba'i bdag nyid kyi mthus so //
translated: By whose power means by the power of the greatness of the conceptualizing wind.

original: yongs su ma shes pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: In the state of non-understanding.

original: 'khor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i lam la'o //
translated: In the path of samsara means in the path of existence.

original: 'gro ba drug gi dbye bas tha dad pa la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi dbye bas tha dad pa la'o //
translated: In the different divisions of the six realms.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nye bar dmigs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here means in the range of perception.

original: 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba ni zo chun rgyud mo'i rigs pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba ni zo chun rgyud mo'i rigs pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Of samsara means in the manner of a waterwheel.

original: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi ngo bo de las gzhan pa'i gnyis brjod par 'dod nas so //
analyzed: gsum pa zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi ngo bo de las gzhan pa'i gnyis brjod par 'dod nas so //
translated: The third means the other two, which are the nature of the syllable hum.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis rtogs zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis sgom pa po rnams kyi yul lo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis rtogs zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis sgom pa po rnams kyi yul lo //
translated: The object of the yogis means the object of those who meditate on the two stages.

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi dgongs pas kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa gnyis kyi dgongs pas kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-conceptual means free from conceptualization by the intention of the two purities.

original: rmad byung che zhes ba ni de dang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis de nyid la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad byung che zhes ba ni de dang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis de nyid la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word great means that it is the appearance of that very thing by the form of that very thing.

original: rlung rnams thams cad 'gog pas na //
analyzed: rlung rnams thams cad 'gog pas na //
translated: By stopping all the winds,

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung bcu 'gog pa dang rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad 'gags pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung bcu 'gog pa dang rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad 'gags pas so //
translated: it means that the ten winds are stopped and the one hundred and eight conceptualizations are stopped.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The word birth means that it will be born.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: de'i phyir de nyid rtogs pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid rtogs pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, realizing that very thing.

original: sems kyi dbang phyug gi sa bon nye bar mtshon pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang phyug gi sa bon nye bar mtshon pa rnams so //
translated: The seed of the lord of mind is indicated.

original: de ltar na don gsum gyis gtso bo'i yi ge bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar na don gsum gyis gtso bo'i yi ge bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the principal syllable by means of three topics,

original: de dngos su byed pa'i thabs brjod par 'dod nas de'i yan lag 'khor lo gsum gyi ngo bo gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de dngos su byed pa'i thabs brjod par 'dod nas de'i yan lag 'khor lo gsum gyi ngo bo gsungs pa ni /
translated: now, wishing to explain the method of directly accomplishing that, the three wheels that are its branches are stated:

original: rlung ni thams cad 'gog pa spangs //🔽zhes bya ba ste /🔽thams cad ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rlung ni thams cad 'gog pa spangs // zhes bya ba ste / thams cad ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Abandoning the stopping of all the winds.

original: bcu po rnams 'gog pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bcu po rnams 'gog pa ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: All means that it is endowed with the number one hundred and eight or that the ten are stopped.🔽The word abandoning means that it is stopped.

original: yang dag ces bya ba ni ma 'khrul pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag ces bya ba ni ma 'khrul pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Correct” means non-erroneous.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa @150b drug pa'i rnam pa can ston pa po'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa @150b drug pa'i rnam pa can ston pa po'o //
translated: “By me” means the teacher who is the Tathāgata.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Reason” means the characteristic of method.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni brjod par gyur pa'o //🔽sprul pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni brjod par gyur pa'o // sprul pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus //
translated: “Explained” means expressed.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gnyis kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gnyis kyi dbus su'o //
translated: “In the middle of the Dharma wheel emanation” means in the middle of the two wheels.

original: padma gnyis su zhes bya ba ni padma gnyis so //
analyzed: padma gnyis su zhes bya ba ni padma gnyis so //
translated: “In the two lotuses” means in the two lotuses.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud bshad pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: “Here” means in the context of explaining the Yoginī Tantras.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //🔽drug cu rtsa bzhi brgyad 'dab gnyis //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gnyis te re re bzhin padma'i dbyibs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o // drug cu rtsa bzhi brgyad 'dab gnyis // zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo gnyis te re re bzhin padma'i dbyibs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Said” means explained.🔽“Sixty-four and eight with two petals” means the two wheels, each of which has the shape of a lotus.

original: de dag za ma tog bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de dag za ma tog bzhin gnas //
translated: “They are arranged like a box” means

original: zhes bya ba ni za ma tog gi tshul khrims kyi steng dang 'og tu kha sbyar ba'i rigs pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni za ma tog gi tshul khrims kyi steng dang 'og tu kha sbyar ba'i rigs pas gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the practice of the discipline of the coffer, which is the principle of the union of the upper and lower parts.

original: gzhan yang steng 'og ces bya ba ni steng dang 'og tu yang dag par brten nas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang steng 'og ces bya ba ni steng dang 'og tu yang dag par brten nas so //
translated: Moreover, the upper and lower parts are the upper and lower parts of the body.

original: srog dang thur sel zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa'i mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo rlung gnyis rgyu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang thur sel zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa'i mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo rlung gnyis rgyu bar byed pa'o //
translated: The life-force and evacuative winds are the two winds that move in the form of the Buddhas Amoghasiddhi and Ratnasambhava.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni gang dag za ma tog bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni gang dag za ma tog bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: Those two are the two winds that abide like a coffer.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one with discursive thought is so called because it generates the conceptualization of objects and the nature of the winds.

original: rlung zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The wind is the nature of the life-force and evacuative winds.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: It is said is taught.

original: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clearly is for the experience of all.

original: sku dang gsung gi snying po gnyis zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel dag go //
analyzed: sku dang gsung gi snying po gnyis zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel dag go //
translated: The two essences of body and speech are the life-force and the downward-voiding [vāyus].

original: yi ge gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yi ge gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because they are the nature of the two syllables,

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang snang ba mtha' yas kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: they are the nature of Vairocana and Amitābha.

original: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The two nāḍīs are lalanā and rasanā.

original: de ltar 'khor lo gnyis kyi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo gnyis kyi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of the two cakras,

original: rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the nature of the central nāḍī,

original: aa ba dh'u t'i'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it says, “the supreme nāḍī, which is free from conceptuality.”

original: mchog gi rtsa zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog gi rtsa zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: “Supreme nāḍī” is the principal one of all nāḍīs.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bshad pa'i 'khor lo dag gi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bshad pa'i 'khor lo dag gi'o //
translated: “Those two” are the two cakras just explained.

original: dbus ma zhes bya ba ni bar du'o //
analyzed: dbus ma zhes bya ba ni bar du'o //
translated: “Central” means in the middle.

original: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni mchog ni rtsa gnyis po dag las mchog ste /
analyzed: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni mchog ni rtsa gnyis po dag las mchog ste /
translated: “Supreme of the supreme” means that the supreme of the two nāḍīs is

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: the most special.

original: rlung zhes bya ba ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba ni rlung ngo //
translated: “Wind” means the wind.

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: “Non-conceptual” means not mixed with conceptualization.

original: gang yin zhes bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: gang yin zhes bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
translated: “Which” means the central channel.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: “Always” means at all times.

original: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //🔽lus 'di thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'gro @151a * //
analyzed: rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni rab tu rgyu ba'o // lus 'di thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'gro @151a * //
translated: “Moving” means moving about.

original: ba'i phyir kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: Because it pervades the entire body, it is “all-pervading.”🔽Because it is the central channel, it is “central.”

original: gang thob ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rgyu ba'i rtsa dbus ma yang dag par thob nas so //
analyzed: gang thob ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung rgyu ba'i rtsa dbus ma yang dag par thob nas so //
translated: “Having attained” means having attained the central channel, the channel in which the conceptual wind moves.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'o //
translated: “The yogi” means the one who meditates on the stage of completion.

original: rtag tu ni zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: “Always” means at all times.

original: sems can don ni byed nus pa //
analyzed: sems can don ni byed nus pa //
translated: “Capable of benefiting sentient beings”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par sems can gyi don byed nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par sems can gyi don byed nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: means “capable of effortlessly benefiting sentient beings,” which is the remainder of the verse.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What is done?

original: de'i phyir / rlung gi rang bzhin bye brag ni //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rlung gi rang bzhin bye brag ni // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the nature of the winds is differentiated.

original: rang bzhin yang yin la rlung yang yin pas na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang yin la rlung yang yin pas na /
translated: Since it is both a nature and a wind,

original: rlung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: it is the nature of the winds.

original: de rnams bya brag ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams bya brag ni dbye ba'o //
translated: Their differentiation is their division.

original: de rnams kyi brgya dang brgyad dang rang bzhin ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi brgya dang brgyad dang rang bzhin ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: Their one hundred and eight natures are one hundred and eight.

original: brgyal nas zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum par gsungs pa'i cho gas spangs nas so //
analyzed: brgyal nas zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum par gsungs pa'i cho gas spangs nas so //
translated: Having fainted means having been abandoned by the method taught in chapter 3.

original: gang gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus mar gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus mar gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: That which abides means abiding in the central channel.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always means at all times.

original: rigs zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Family means by the previously explained specific yoga.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Ignorance means not an object.

original: rnal 'byor byis pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su mi shes pas rnal 'byor yang yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor byis pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su mi shes pas rnal 'byor yang yin te /
translated: The childish yogi is a yogi who does not fully understand the completion stage.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa tsam bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: He meditates on the generation stage alone.

original: rnal 'byor byis pas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor byis pas so //
translated: The child of yoga.

original: yang na rigs pa mi shes pa //
analyzed: yang na rigs pa mi shes pa //
translated: Or, not knowing reasoning,

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: is connected with this.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is outside of the reasoning of direct perception and inference.

original: skad cig gcig rdzogs mngon byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig rdzogs mngon byang chub //
translated: In one instant, complete, manifest enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i gnas skabs thob pa'i dus su skad cig gcig la bya ba rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i gnas skabs thob pa'i dus su skad cig gcig la bya ba rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: This is the characteristic of the completion of action in one instant, at the time of attaining the state of the avadhūtī.

original: mngon par byang chub pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Manifest enlightenment is the attainment of buddhahood itself.

original: de yis thob par zhes bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i ngo bos thob pas so //
analyzed: de yis thob par zhes bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'i'i ngo bos thob pas so //
translated: By that, it is attained, by the attainment of the nature of the avadhūtī.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi theg par ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi theg par ro //
translated: Here, in the mantra vehicle.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said, it is expressed.

original: de ni gang tshe skad cig 'thob //
analyzed: de ni gang tshe skad cig 'thob //
translated: That is attained in an instant.

original: ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: This is manifest enlightenment in one instant.

original: de ni skad cig ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig gis mngon pa byang chub pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni skad cig ces bya ba ni skad cig gcig gis mngon pa byang chub pa 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is called “instantaneous” because it has the characteristic of attaining manifest enlightenment in one instant.

original: mchog tu gsungs zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob gcig pu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu gsungs zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob gcig pu bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is said to be supreme because it is taught to be the only conventional [truth].

original: de'i ngo bo de kho na nyid ma mthong bas brjod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo de kho na nyid ma mthong bas brjod par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Since its essence is not seen as reality, it is indeed inexpressible.

original: de ltar rtsa dbus ma'i rang gi ngo bo bstan nas de thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa dbus ma'i rang gi ngo bo bstan nas de thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus explained the essence of the central channel, in order to express the essence of the method for attaining it, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de yang ji ltar 'thob par byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'thob par byed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “How is that attained?”

original: rtsa dbus ma la @151b brten nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa dbus ma la @151b brten nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Relying on the central channel, [there is] manifest enlightenment in one instant.

original: ji ltar thob par byed ces bya ba ni thabs gang gis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thob par byed ces bya ba ni thabs gang gis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: “How is it attained?” is [asking] by what method is it realized?

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Reason” is application.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “There” is for the sake of attaining that.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: “Declare” is to express.

original: rigs pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that reason?

original: de'i phyir thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “First of all,” and so on.

original: rnal 'byor chen po ni zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi theg pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byang chub mngon du byed pa la phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ni zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi theg pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byang chub mngon du byed pa la phyogs pa'o //
translated: “ Great yogi” means one who is intent on realizing enlightenment by following the mantra vehicle.

original: zhi gnas sgom zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas sgom zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la goms par byed pa'o //
translated: “ Cultivating śamatha” means becoming familiar with samādhi, which is the cause of one-pointed mind.

original: blo bzang gis ni zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa shes pa'i phyir ro //🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: blo bzang gis ni zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa shes pa'i phyir ro // bskyed pa'i rim pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: “ With a good mind” means knowing how to meditate according to the instructions.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i bsgom pas so //
translated: “ With the yoga of the creation stage” means with the meditation on the moon, vajra, and so on.

original: phyag rgya byas nas zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnam par bskyed nas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya byas nas zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnam par bskyed nas so //
translated: “ Having made the seal” means having created the deity’s form.

original: 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba ni me ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad sreg par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i zhes bya ba ni me ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad sreg par byed pas so //
translated: “ Blazing” means burning, like fire, all conceptuality.

original: bsdams zhes bya ba ni bsdams par byas nas so //
analyzed: bsdams zhes bya ba ni bsdams par byas nas so //
translated: “ Restrained” means having restrained.

original: dbang po'i sgo ni sgo dgu la //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ni sgo dgu la //
translated: The doors of the senses are the nine doors.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i yul la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i yul la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams so //
translated: The nature of the appropriate objects, etc.

original: dgu'i grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dgu'i grangs kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: dgu'i grangs kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dgu'i grangs kyi dbye bas so //
translated: The enumeration of the nine is the division of the nine, eye, etc.

original: h'um bzlas pa ni mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: h'um bzlas pa ni mtshungs pa med //
translated: The recitation of HUM is incomparable.

original: ces bya ba ni sems kyi bzlas pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems kyi bzlas pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: This is the form of mental recitation.

original: h'um gcig nyid la rnam pa gsum du 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang ldang ba rnams la sbyar nas dbugs kyi 'khor lo mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um gcig nyid la rnam pa gsum du 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang ldang ba rnams la sbyar nas dbugs kyi 'khor lo mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The single HUM is applied to the three aspects of entering, abiding, and rising, and the wheel of breath is indicated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs pa med ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be incomparable.🔽It is free from the characteristics of the external recitation of the syllable HUM.

original: phyi rol gyi h'um yig gi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbugs kyi rim pas nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi h'um yig gi bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbugs kyi rim pas nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: This is indicated by the process of the breath.

original: mchog tu rgyun mi chad par bya //
analyzed: mchog tu rgyun mi chad par bya //
translated: One should perform the supreme uninterrupted.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs kyi grangs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs kyi grangs kyis so //
translated: This is by the enumeration of the breaths, twenty-four thousand times in a day and night.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term supreme is because it is the cause of the neuter repetition.

original: dus ji tsam du zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji tsam du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa phyi ma'i dus de tsam gyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa phyi ma'i dus de tsam gyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: Therefore, as long as the mindfulness of exhalation and inhalation lasts, that is, until the end of that.

original: bzlas pa ni zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi sgo nas dbugs kyi 'khor lo mtshon par byas nas so //
analyzed: bzlas pa ni zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi sgo nas dbugs kyi 'khor lo mtshon par byas nas so //
translated: The term repetition is because the wheel of breath is indicated by means of the syllable hūṃ.

original: de zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i rjes la'o //
translated: The term that is in reference to the moon.

original: skad cig de la thob ces bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'ir zhugs nas skad cig gcig rdzogs mngon par byang chub pa'i skad gcig ma'o //🔽de ltar de thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi ngo bo bstan nas thabs bsgom pa'i @152a * //
analyzed: skad cig de la thob ces bya ba ni aa ba dh'u t'ir zhugs nas skad cig gcig rdzogs mngon par byang chub pa'i skad gcig ma'o // de ltar de thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi ngo bo bstan nas thabs bsgom pa'i @152a * //
translated: The term attained in that instant is the instant of manifest enlightenment that is completed in one instant, having entered the avadhūtī.

original: lugs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lugs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of the means of attaining that, in order to teach the system of cultivating the means,

original: gang phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, because of that, etc.

original: de ni bzlas byas na zhes bya ba ni h'um yig de 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar gyur pas gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bzlas byas na zhes bya ba ni h'um yig de 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar gyur pas gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir ro //
translated: That is, if one recites means that the syllable hum is applied to the inhalations, etc. For what reason? means for what cause?.

original: snying ga'i padma zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i padma'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i padma zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i padma'o //
translated: The heart lotus is the lotus of the dharmacakra.

original: steng bltas 'gro zhes bya ba ni za ma tog la kha phye bas steng gi phyogs su 'gro ba ste kha bkag phye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir 'gro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: steng bltas 'gro zhes bya ba ni za ma tog la kha phye bas steng gi phyogs su 'gro ba ste kha bkag phye bar 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir 'gro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Looking upward, it goes means that it goes in the upward direction, opening the casket, that is, it opens the closed casket.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas gsang ba'i padma las //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ro // de nas gsang ba'i padma las //
translated: For that very reason, it is said it goes, that is, it goes.

original: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i padma sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i ngo bo de las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i padma sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i ngo bo de las so //
translated: Then, from the secret lotus means from the secret lotus, which is the nature of the emanation chakra.

original: phye ba zhes bya ba ni za ma tog bcings pa bzlog par brjod pa'o //🔽rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gnyis ni //
analyzed: phye ba zhes bya ba ni za ma tog bcings pa bzlog par brjod pa'o // rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gnyis ni //
translated: Opening means reversing the closed casket.🔽The two conceptual winds

original: zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel gyi rlung gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog dang thur sel gyi rlung gnyis kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: are the nature of the two winds, life-force and downward-voiding.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni za ma tog kha phye ba'i rjes la /🔽rnam par bcad nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni steng dang 'og gi rgyu ba bzlog nas dbu mar zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni za ma tog kha phye ba'i rjes la / rnam par bcad nas 'gro zhes bya ba ni steng dang 'og gi rgyu ba bzlog nas dbu mar zhugs te /
translated: Then, after opening the box,🔽having cut off, having turned back the upward and downward movements,

original: ro gcig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro gcig par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it enters the central channel, and becomes of one taste, is the meaning.

original: de ltar thabs bsgom pa bstan nas thabs las byung ba thob pa'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /🔽rnam rtog med pa'i rlung chen po //
analyzed: de ltar thabs bsgom pa bstan nas thabs las byung ba thob pa'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir / rnam rtog med pa'i rlung chen po //
translated: Having thus taught the cultivation of the method, in order to state the nature of the attainment of the result of the method,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, the great wind of non-conceptuality,

original: aa ba dh'u t'i'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
translated: which is the nature of the avadhūtī.

original: sku gsum rdo rjes bcad nas ni //
analyzed: sku gsum rdo rjes bcad nas ni //
translated: Having cut off with the vajra of the three bodies,

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis kyi rgyu ba srog dang thur sel gyi bdag nyid can 'khor lo gnyis las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin bcad nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa gnyis kyi rgyu ba srog dang thur sel gyi bdag nyid can 'khor lo gnyis las byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin bcad nas so //
translated: having cut off the movements of the two channels, which are of the nature of the life-force and downward-voiding winds, which arise from the two cakras, which are of the nature of body and speech,

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: non-conceptuality means that it does not change into another aspect in dependence on natural purity.

original: bde ba ster zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bde ba ster zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i ngo bo zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The bliss is the nature of the bliss of the undefiled nature of vajra repetition.

original: thob ces bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thob ces bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment is the realization.

original: sngags kyi de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i h'um bsgoms pas so //🔽aa ba dh'u t'i'i rgyun la gnas //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i h'um bsgoms pas so // aa ba dh'u t'i'i rgyun la gnas //
translated: The mantra reality is the meditation on the previously mentioned hum.

original: zhes bya ba ni g-yon dang g-yas pa'i rgyu ba bzlog nas dbus ma'i rgyu ba'i gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni g-yon dang g-yas pa'i rgyu ba bzlog nas dbus ma'i rgyu ba'i gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The abiding in the stream of the avadhuti is the abiding in the central channel, because the movements in the left and right channels have been reversed.

original: smin dbus zhes bya ba ni rlung gi 'khor lo'i gnas so //
analyzed: smin dbus zhes bya ba ni rlung gi 'khor lo'i gnas so //
translated: The middle of the eyebrows is the location of the wind mandala.

original: rlung gis phye byas la zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ngo bo 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gis phye byas la zhes bya ba ni thig le'i ngo bo 'byed pa'o //
translated: The opening by the wind is the opening of the nature of the drop.

original: 'di thob ces bya ba ni dbus mar 'jug pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thob ces bya ba ni dbus mar 'jug pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of this is the attainment of entry into the middle.

original: thob byas dga' bas ni zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag gi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: thob byas dga' bas ni zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i bye brag gi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The joy of the attainment is the nature of the various joys.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba rtag pas so //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni dga' ba rtag pas so //
translated: The inexhaustible is the permanent joy.

original: rtag tu 'char zhing zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'khor bar gnas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'char zhing zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'khor bar gnas kyi bar du'o //
translated: “Always arising” means for as long as one remains in cyclic existence.

original: chags sogs bral zhing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya rtsa @152b brgyad bzlog pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chags sogs bral zhing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya rtsa @152b brgyad bzlog pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Free from attachment and so forth” means that it is the nature of the reversal of the one hundred and eight natural heaps.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: “Peace” means that it is primordially peaceful, and so is essenceless.

original: rang rig ces bya ba ni so so rang gi sa rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig ces bya ba ni so so rang gi sa rig par bya ba'o //
translated: “Self-awareness” means that it is to be known by each one for him or herself.

original: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad las zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad las zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: “Great bliss” means that it is the reversal of all suffering.

original: de ltar don rnam pa lngas de mngon du byed pa'i thabs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa lngas de mngon du byed pa'i thabs bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the method of realizing it through five topics,

original: thabs las byung ba thob pa'i dus su rtags brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs las byung ba thob pa'i dus su rtags brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to state the signs that occur at the time of attaining the result of the method,

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “signs” and so forth.

original: rtags so // 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbus ma sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
analyzed: rtags so // 'di la zhes bya ba ni dbus ma sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor ba'i'o //
translated: “Signs” means “indications.” “Here” means in the middle, for the meditator, the yogi.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: “Should be explained” means “should be stated.”

original: gsang sngags grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi spyod pas grub pa'i phyir grub pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags grub pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi spyod pas grub pa'i phyir grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplished one of the secret mantra is the accomplished one because of accomplishment by the practice of the mantra.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa pos so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa pos so //
translated: The yogin is the one who meditates.

original: 'dar dang zhes bya ba ni rlung gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa po dang nye ba'i phyir lus 'dar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dar dang zhes bya ba ni rlung gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa po dang nye ba'i phyir lus 'dar ba'o //
translated: The trembling is the trembling of the body because of the manifestation of the essence of the wind and the proximity of the near attainment.

original: rdul dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi rnam 'gyur 'byung ba'i phyir re //
analyzed: rdul dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi rnam 'gyur 'byung ba'i phyir re //
translated: The sweat is the arising of the manifestation of the bodhicitta.

original: ba spu langs zhes bya ba ni ba spu'i rtsa ba rdul ba'o //
analyzed: ba spu langs zhes bya ba ni ba spu'i rtsa ba rdul ba'o //
translated: The hair standing on end is the trembling of the root of the hair.

original: rtag tu dga' ba'i bsam pa dang // zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yid mi bde ba bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' ba'i bsam pa dang // zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yid mi bde ba bzlog pa'o //
translated: The always joyful intention is the reversal of mental unhappiness at all times.

original: gdong ni zhes bya ba ni byad kyi gdong ngo //
analyzed: gdong ni zhes bya ba ni byad kyi gdong ngo //
translated: The face is the face of the body.

original: zangs mdog yid du 'ong zhes bya ba ni zangs dang 'dra bar 'bar bar 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zangs mdog yid du 'ong zhes bya ba ni zangs dang 'dra bar 'bar bar 'gyur ba gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: The beautiful copper color is that which has the radiance like copper.

original: kun gyis mthong nas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad dga' ba'o //
analyzed: kun gyis mthong nas zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad dga' ba'o //
translated: All see means all yogins and yoginis.

original: mchog tu bde ba ster bar byed pas so //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba ster bar byed pas so //
translated: Because it bestows supreme bliss.

original: grang dang lhag par tsha zhes bya ba ni grang dang tsha ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grang dang lhag par tsha zhes bya ba ni grang dang tsha ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Cold and excessive heat means producing cold and heat.

original: des zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnal 'byor pa la'o //
translated: By that means by the yoga that was just explained.

original: gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de la dga' ba dang / gdung ba la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gis de la dga' ba dang / gdung ba la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: No harm will come means that joy, sorrow, and so on will not arise for them.

original: 'jig rten chos dang zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos dang zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: Worldly dharmas are the eight, such as praise and blame.

original: de bzhin gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams so //
translated: Likewise others are others.

original: gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: No harm will come means not producing attachment and aversion.🔽 To that means to the yogin.🔽

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la'o //
translated: The supreme means the supreme yoga.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme of all yogas.🔽 🔽The supreme of all means the supreme

original: sngags kyi de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi ngo bo sngags kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa pos so //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni h'um yig gi ngo bo sngags kyi de kho na nyid sgom pa pos so //
translated: The reality of mantra is the reality of the mantra, which is the essence of the syllable hūṃ, by the meditator.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Vajra-garland, a great yoga tantra,

original: pandi ta aa lang+ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lang+ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: composed by the paṇḍita Alaṅkārapāda.

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: The extensive explanation of the twenty-second chapter from the commentary called Illuminating the Profound Meaning,🔽is completed.

original: // / @153a * //  de ltar le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa yi ge gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: // / @153a * //  de ltar le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa yi ge gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the domain of the three syllables in the twenty-second chapter,

original: da ni de kho na nyid gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to express the reply to the question about the domain of the three realities,

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa ston par byed cing /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa ston par byed cing /
translated: the twenty-third chapter is taught.

original: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: First, at the beginning, it is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After the explanation of the twenty-second chapter.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma la ltos nas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma la ltos nas so //
translated: Moreover, in dependence on the previous.

original: nyon zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word listen

original: zhu ba po nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: zhu ba po nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
translated: is the application of the petitioner to the hearing.

original: de nyid gsum gyi tshig bstan bya //🔽zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid gsum gyi tshig bstan bya // zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The words of the three realities are to be taught.

original: de kho na nyid gsum pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum pa ni /
translated: The three realities are

original: bdag dang sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi tshig rnam par rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi tshig rnam par rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis bstan par bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the words that express the characteristics of the reality of the self, mantra, and intuition, and are to be taught by the nature of the speaker.

original: brjod par bya ba'i don la nges par byed pa bstan par bya zhes bya ba'o //🔽ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don la nges par byed pa bstan par bya zhes bya ba'o // ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The meaning of to be taught is to be ascertained with regard to the meaning to be expressed.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid sogs dbye bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid sogs dbye bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: How? Therefore, it is said by the division of the self, etc.,

original: sogs ba'i sgras ni sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs ba'i sgras ni sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: and by the word etc., the reality of mantra and intuition are to be understood as included.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As it is means

original: phyin ci log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: by the nature of non-error.

original: rim pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rim pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rim pa rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rim pas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The stages means by the stages of the reality of the self, etc. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the composition,

original: dngos su bshad pa brjod ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su bshad pa brjod ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the actual text,

original: de'i yan lag bdag gis de kho na nyid mdor bstan pa ni bdag gi de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i yan lag bdag gis de kho na nyid mdor bstan pa ni bdag gi de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: the branch of that, the teaching of reality by me, is called the reality of the self.

original: kun du brtags pa phung po lnga'i tshogs kyi de nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo bdag gis de kho na nyid ces brjod do //🔽rnal 'byor mchog ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa phung po lnga'i tshogs kyi de nyid ni ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo bdag gis de kho na nyid ces brjod do // rnal 'byor mchog ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The reality of the collection of the five aggregates of the imagined is the nature of the Tathagatas Vairochana and so forth, who abide just as they are. I call that the reality of the self.

original: bsam gtan mchog gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan mchog gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The supreme yoga is the nature of supreme meditation, because it is free from the characteristics of an ordinary person.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi rgyu //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi rgyu //
translated: The cause of Vajrasattva himself

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yongs su shes pas rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yongs su shes pas rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: is the attainment of the state of Vajrasattva through the complete understanding of the nature of the five aggregates as the five Tathagatas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin bdag /
translated: The nature of all the Buddhas is the self.

original: ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: This is the nature of the essence of the body, speech, and mind of the five Tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pu //
translated: The one body of all Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pu'o //
translated: This is the one body of all Buddhas, which is the nature of the essence of the five Buddhas.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the form of Great Vajradhara.

original: kun mkhyen @153b go 'phang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po thams cad la sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bos shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun mkhyen @153b go 'phang zhes bya ba ni khams gsum po thams cad la sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bos shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of omniscience, because of the knowledge of the three realms by the nature of the five Buddhas.

original: mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi ngo bo dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gyi ngo bo dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The unclear, because of the removal of the nature of form.

original: rigs kyi dbye bas rab gsal byed //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye bas rab gsal byed //
translated: The clear by the division of the families.

original: ces bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa sbyang pa'i thabs kyis gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa sbyang pa'i thabs kyis gti mug la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is the clear by the division of the families of delusion and so forth, by the method of purifying the fundamental afflictions.

original: rigs lnga'i rnam pa gang zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rnam pa gang zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase “in the aspect of the five families” means that they are in the nature of Vairocana and the others.

original: de ni phung po lnga yi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni phung po lnga yi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the defining characteristic of the five aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de ltar bdag gi de kho na nyid mdor bstan pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi de kho na nyid mdor bstan pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the brief teaching on the reality of the self,

original: de rgyas par bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach its extensive explanation,

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rnam par dag pa ni /🔽phra rags la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rnam par dag pa ni / phra rags la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: the purity of the aggregate of form

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is taught by the divisions of gross and subtle, etc.

original: de la rags pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de la rags pa ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: Therein, the gross is the aggregate of form,

original: phyi rol du de'i ngo bos snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du de'i ngo bos snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it appears externally in that nature.

original: phra ba ni de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: phra ba ni de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The subtle is the others, such as feeling, etc.,

original: gzugs med pa nyid kyis rags pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nyid kyis rags pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are formless and do not appear as gross.

original: thogs bcas thogs med mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: thogs bcas thogs med mtshan nyid can //
translated: The defining characteristic of the obstruction and nonobstruction,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Form is obstructive,

original: rang gi yul phyogs la gzhan skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul phyogs la gzhan skye ba 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obstructs the arising of other forms in the place occupied by itself.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni thogs med de /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni thogs med de /
translated: Feeling, etc., are not obstructive,

original: snga ma las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the opposite of the former.

original: thogs pa ces dang thogs med ni thogs bcas dang thogs med dag ste /
analyzed: thogs pa ces dang thogs med ni thogs bcas dang thogs med dag ste /
translated: Obstructive and non-obstructive are the same as obstructive and non-obstructive.

original: de nyid ni mtshan gang la yod pa de rnams ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni mtshan gang la yod pa de rnams ni /
translated: Those that have that characteristic are

original: thogs bcas dang thogs med rnams so //
analyzed: thogs bcas dang thogs med rnams so //
translated: obstructive and non-obstructive.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi yi dngos //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi yi dngos //
translated: The entities of the four great elements

original: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i bdag ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i bdag ste /
translated: are the great elements of earth, etc.

original: des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established by that.

original: gzugs kyi phung por zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The aggregate of form is that which has the characteristic of form.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i bstan pa la'o //
translated: Here means in the Buddhist teaching.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said means it is expressed.

original: der ni rnam snang ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: der ni rnam snang ngo bo dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of the form aggregate is the essence of Vairocana.

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag nyid kyis gzugs brnyan bzhin du khyad par du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag nyid kyis gzugs brnyan bzhin du khyad par du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a reflection, because it appears through the mirror-like pristine awareness, which is the same and different.

original: thams cad spro bar byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: thams cad spro bar byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the emanation of all.

original: zhes bya ba ste thams cad ni rang gi rigs dang 'brel pa'i lhan cig spyod ma dang / rjes su spyod ma la sog pa spro bar byed pas na thams cad spro bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //🔽de @154a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste thams cad ni rang gi rigs dang 'brel pa'i lhan cig spyod ma dang / rjes su spyod ma la sog pa spro bar byed pas na thams cad spro bar byed pa'i rgyu'o // de @154a * //
translated: The cause of the emanation of all is the cause of the emanation of all the consorts and followers connected with one's own family.

original: ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the purification of the form aggregate,

original: tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the purification of the aggregate of feeling,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, pleasure and pain,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal lo //
translated: pleasure and pain.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
translated: Supreme means the highest.

original: zhi zhes bya ba ni mchog ma yin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba ni mchog ma yin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: “Peace” is the aspect of non-excellence and equanimity.

original: grang dang dro ba zhes bya ba ni de dang reg pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: grang dang dro ba zhes bya ba ni de dang reg pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “Cold and warm” is the aspect of contact with that.

original: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni phra ba dang rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni phra ba dang rags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Supreme of the supreme” is the nature of subtle and coarse.

original: rig pa ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: “Knowledge” is experience.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i rnam pa'i shes pas so //
translated: “By which” is the consciousness of the aspect of thorough discrimination.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “That” is the nature of such experience.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni phal che bas so //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni phal che bas so //
translated: “For the most part” is by the majority.

original: tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the aggregate of feeling.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: bde sdug la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi mtshan nyid can gyi tshor ba la sogs pa'i stong pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
